metadata: Defines types for pages with primary layout and app props with layout in a Next.js project.
Defines the IUser interface with properties uid and email in redux.types.ts.

This file defines the Redux store configuration for the HyperNext project. It imports necessary functions from '@reduxjs/toolkit' and the userReducer from './slices/userSlice'. The combinedReducer combines the userReducer. The setupStore function configures the store with the combinedReducer. Types AppStore, RootState, and ReduxState are defined based on the store setup. Finally, the store is configured using the combinedReducer.

This file is the userSlice.ts located in the path ../../HyperNext/src/app/redux/slices/. It defines a Redux slice for managing user state in the application. The slice includes actions to set user data, set user email, set user UID, and clear user data. The initial state for the user slice contains an empty user ID and email.

File: meta.ts
Description: This file contains constants related to the product information of HyperNext project, including the product name, tagline, description, and copyright details.

This file is globals.css located at ../../HyperNext/src/styles/globals.css. It contains global CSS variables for foreground and background colors, media query for dark mode, styles for a gradient body, and basic body styles like margin and line-height.

This file is Container.tsx located in the path ../../HyperNext/src/components/. It contains a functional component called Container that takes children and className as props. The component renders a div with the class 'container mx-auto' along with any additional className provided, and renders the children inside it.
This file contains the implementation of the `IconWrapper` component in TypeScript. The component takes an `icon` prop, clones it, and adds a class name `IconWrapperClass` to it before rendering it.

This file is SectionTitle.tsx located at ../../HyperNext/src/components/SectionTitle.tsx. It defines a React component called SectionTitle that takes in props for alignment, pretitle, title, and children. The component renders a section title with optional pretitle and children within a Container component. The alignment of the title can be set to 'left' or 'center'.

This file is ThemeSwitch.tsx located in ../../HyperNext/src/components/ directory. It contains a functional component called ThemeChanger that allows users to switch between light and dark themes using local storage. The component utilizes the useTheme hook from next-themes to manage the theme state and theme switching functionality.

This file is Intro.tsx located at ../../HyperNext/src/components/Landing/Intro.tsx. It contains the introduction section of the Next.js Template project. The component includes a title, product description, a link to the GitHub repository, an image, and a section showcasing logos of trusted companies.

This file is BenefitBullet.tsx located at ../../HyperNext/src/components/Landing/BenefitBullet.tsx. It contains a React component called BenefitBullet that takes in props for an icon, title, and children to render a styled bullet point for displaying benefits.

This file, Benefits.tsx, is located at ../../HyperNext/src/components/Landing/Benefits.tsx. It contains a React functional component called Benefits, which takes in props imgPos and data of type TBenefits. The component renders a section displaying benefits, including an image, title, description, and a list of bullet points. The layout adjusts based on the imgPos prop to display the image on the left or right side.

This file (ReduxSetExample.tsx) is located at ../../HyperNext/src/components/Examples/ReduxSetExample.tsx. It contains a React functional component named ReduxSetExample. Within this component, it imports setUserUid from '@/redux/slices/userSlice', useEffect and useDispatch from 'react', and utilizes them to dispatch an action to set a user UID ('e2d6c15f-6eae-57ed-8122-a801d3d4fd5c') when the component mounts. The component simply renders a <div> element with the text 'ReduxSetExample'.

This file is ReactQueryExample.tsx located at ../../HyperNext/src/components/Examples/ReactQueryExample.tsx. It contains a functional component that utilizes the useGithubUser hook to fetch and display GitHub user data. If loading, it shows 'Loading...', and if there's an error, it logs the error message. Finally, it renders the user's name and bio if available.

This file is ReduxFetchExample.tsx located at ../../HyperNext/src/components/Examples/ReduxFetchExample.tsx. It contains a React functional component that demonstrates fetching data from a Redux store using useSelector hook and accessing the state. The component also includes a useEffect hook to log the user's unique identifier (uid) when it changes.

This file contains the code for the Navbar component in a Next.js project. It includes a responsive navigation bar with links to different sections such as Product, Features, Pricing, Company, and Blog. The Navbar also includes a ThemeSwitch component for toggling between light and dark themes.

This file is PrimaryLayout.tsx located at ../../HyperNext/src/layouts/PrimaryLayout.tsx. It defines a React functional component called PrimaryLayout that serves as the primary layout for the project. The component includes a Navbar, a Container component for the main content, and a Footer. It also handles page metadata such as title and description using props or default values from constants.

This file is the Footer component located at ../../HyperNext/src/layouts/Footer.tsx. It includes navigation items, legal items, and social items. The component renders a footer section with links to different pages, legal information, and social media links. It also displays the product name, description, and copyright information.
This file is located at ../../HyperNext/src/api/github.api.ts and it contains functions to fetch a GitHub user's data and a custom hook to use that data.

File: benefits.tsx

Description: This file contains the data structure for defining primary and secondary benefits in the HyperNext project template. It includes the type definitions for benefits, bullets, and icons. The file also defines the primary and secondary benefits objects with titles, descriptions, images, and corresponding bullet points with icons. Additionally, it exports the IconWrapperClass constant for styling purposes.

This file is the index page of the HyperNext project. It imports various components such as Benefits, Intro, SectionTitle, and PrimaryLayout. It also imports constants, data, and font styles. The page displays an introduction section and two sections for displaying primary and secondary benefits. The layout for the page is defined using the PrimaryLayout component.

This file is located at ../../HyperNext/src/pages/_document.tsx and it contains the custom document structure for the Next.js project. It imports Html, Head, Main, and NextScript from 'next/document' and defines a Document component that renders the basic HTML structure with the main content and Next.js scripts.

This file is _app.tsx located at ../../HyperNext/src/pages/_app.tsx. It contains the main component for customizing the Next.js App. The file imports necessary dependencies like store, global styles, AppPropsWithLayout type, ThemeProvider, ReduxProvider, ReactQueryClient, and ReactQueryProvider. The default function App renders the layout with the provided component and page props, wrapping them with ReduxProvider, ThemeProvider, and ReactQueryProvider for state management and theming.
This file contains an API route in Next.js located at ../../HyperNext/src/pages/api/hello.ts. The API route responds with a JSON object containing a name property set to 'John Doe' when accessed.
